intro: Ceropegia codonoides, commonly known as the string of hearts, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or white, which are pollinated by specific insects. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires bright, indirect light to flourish. Ceropegia codonoides is popular as a houseplant due to its attractive foliage and relatively easy care requirements.
